title: easy asparagus recipe with mediterranean salsa
directions: Make the Mediterranean salsa. In a mixing bowl, add the tomatoes, shallots, garlic and herbs. Season with salt, pepper, and sumac. Add lemon juice and a generous drizzle of extra virgin olive oil. Mix and set aside so flavors will meld nicely (or, if you prefer, cover and chill until ready to serve).
In a large sacuepan, bring 8 cups of water to a boil. Seasoned with 2 tbsp salt. Have a large bowl of ice water ready next to it (ice bath).

When water comes to a rolling boil, add the prepared asparagus. Boil until tender, 3 to 4 minutes (depending on thickness).Â Remove with tongs, or drain in a colander, and immediately transfer to ice water for 1 minute to stop the cooking process. Drain; set aside to cool down (or if you prefer, chill in the fridge until ready to serve.)
When ready to serve, arrange the asparagus on a serving platter. Season with salt and pepper. Add a drizzle of good extra virgin olive oil and lemon zest. Top with the Mediterranean salsa. Enjoy!
ingredients: 12 oz cherry tomatoes, chopped or halved (place in a small sieve over a bowl to drain a little)
1/4 cup chopped fresh mint leaves (or basil chiffonade, if you prefer)
Salt and pepper, more for later
Early Harvest Greek extra virgin olive oil, more for later
